He visited Leuven a couple of months ago. I went there to listen to his speech. He was sitting in the corner of a half empty lecture room. Only a few people came. When I approached him and politely asked whether I could take a picture with him, he just turned away and said no. Did not even look. The man needs to keep his ego in check. Why does the horsey move so crazy? Because the origin of chess was a simulation of real life battles in war, and knights on horses move like that. The the rook is like a Roman ballista, it launches projectiles in a straight line, and the bishop is the archer firing arrows on the diagonal.

the knight in chess moves eight squares through the L shape
the knight in shogi moves only two squares to the front and left or right
the knight in chinese chess moves eight squares through the L shape but it has to move two squares forward and one square to the side and it can be blocked by a piece if it is in the knight's first square to the front .
